title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in several provinces
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showery conditions are expected to be enhanced in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North-western, and Northern provinces, and in Galle and Matara districts during the next few days.

title: Train services restricted amid station masters’ strike
byline: The General Manager of Sri Lanka Railways, Dhammika Jayasundara, announced that train services will be limited to short-distance routes such as Galle, Negombo, and Veyangoda today (May 17).

title: Russia says Ukraine talks yielded a prisoner swap deal and an agreement to keep talking
byline: Russia said on Friday that the first direct talks with Ukraine in more than three years had yielded a deal to swap 1,000 prisoners of war each soon and to resume talks after each side had set out its vision for a future ceasefire.

title: Further details emerge on Kotahena shooting incident
byline: More details have been revealed regarding the shooting incident that took place last evening (16) in front of a residence on Sumithrarama Road, within the Kotahena Police Division.

title: Moody’s cuts America’s pristine credit rating, citing rising debt
byline: Moody’s downgraded the U.S. sovereign credit rating on Friday due to concerns about the nation’s growing, $36 trillion debt pile, in a move that could complicate President Donald Trump’s efforts to cut taxes and send ripples through global markets.

title: Court orders release of several suspects in Easter Sunday attacks case
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court on Thursday (May 16) ordered the release of ten male suspects and two female suspects who had previously been granted bail, after being arrested in connection with allegations of aiding and abetting the 2019 Easter Sunday attacks.

title: Issuance of number plates for new vehicles temporarily suspended
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has announced that the issuance of number plates for newly registered motor vehicles has been temporarily suspended due to a shortage of number plates.

title: Govt aims to build humanitarian generation respecting cultural diversity — PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya participated in the Vajra Jayanti celebration of the Sirirathnajothi Pirivena Educational Institute in Urupola, Matara, held yesterday (16).

title: Ministry expresses displeasure over ‘unjust’ railway strike despite solutions provided
byline: The Ministry of Transport has issued a statement condemning the one-day token strike launched by railway station masters from midnight on May 16, describing it as an “unjust” action that has caused undue inconvenience to the public, despite ongoing efforts by the Ministry to address their concerns.

title: Train services restricted amidst station masters’ strike
byline: The General Manager of Sri Lanka Railways, Dhammika Jayasundara, announced that train services will be limited to short-distance routes such as Galle, Negombo, and Veyangoda today (May 17).

title: Motorcycle rider involved in Mount Lavinia shooting arrested
byline: The rider of the motorcycle involved in the fatal shooting of a 19-year-old youth near the Sylvester Road junction in Mount Lavinia has been arrested yesterday (16), police said.

title: Bandarawela SLTB bus strike over assault on driver
byline: A bus driver attached to the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) depot in Bandarawela was reportedly assaulted by an intoxicated passenger, prompting a strike today (17), during which all buses were withdrawn from service and parked within the depot premises.

title: Ontario court grants extradition of Sri Lankan gang leader arrested in Toronto last year
byline: An Ontario judge has granted the extradition of a Sri Lankan gang leader arrested in Toronto last year for his alleged role in a deadly attack on a rival gang near Paris in 2022.

title: Cannes Classics: Inside the challenging restoration of Sri Lankan masterpiece ‘Gehenu Lamai’
byline: As Sumitra Peries’ landmark 1978 debut “Gehenu Lamai” (The Girls) prepares for its restored world premiere at Cannes Classics, India’s Film Heritage Foundation has revealed the extraordinary technical challenges overcome during the film’s painstaking restoration process.

title: CEB proposes 18.3% electricity tariff hike for June–Dec 2025
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has submitted a proposal to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) seeking an 18.3% increase in electricity tariffs for the period from June to December 2025.

title: Apple blocks Fortnite game on iPhones, video game company says
byline: Apple has blocked access to the online game Fortnite on iPhone devices in the United States and the European Union, according to the video game maker.

title: Russian attack kills 9, Ukraine says, just hours after peace talks
byline: A Russian drone hit a bus, killing nine people and injuring four more in the northeastern Ukrainian region of Sumy, officials said on Saturday, in an attack that took place hours after Moscow and Kyiv held their first direct peace talks in years.

title: Night mail trains cancelled for second consecutive day
byline: The Railway Department has announced the cancellation of all night mail train services scheduled for tonight (17) due to the ongoing strike by the Sri Lanka Railway Station Masters’ Union.

title: Indian mission in Sri Lanka organises exhibition on Buddhist Sculptural Heritage
byline: The Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka, along with Swami Vivekananda Cultural Centre and Bihar Museum, organised ‘Dhamma Rupa’ exhibition as part of the Buddha Rashmi Vesak Festival at Seemamalakaya, Gangaramaya Temple in Colombo.

title: Battle for Colombo Mayorship heats up
byline: The election for the position of Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC), which has attracted much attention following the recent local government elections, will likely take a heated turn, according to political sources.

title: Sri Lankan experts arrive in Pakistan to examine ailing elephants
byline: A team of Sri Lankan veterinary experts, led by Dr Buddika Bhandara and committee member Yusra Askari, arrived in Karachi on Friday for a 17-day visit to assess the health of two female elephants, Madhubala and Malika, at Safari Park.

title: Increasing productivity to attract investments vital for Sri Lanka - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the development of a country depends on the productive contribution its citizens make towards the nation.

title: Decentralization of President’s Fund at divisional level significantly expanded access - President’s Secretary
byline: A special training workshop was held today (17) at the President’s Media Centre (PMC)  for officials in charge of implementing activities related to the President’s Fund across Divisional Secretariats in the Western Province.

title: Severe storms kill at least 21 in Kentucky and Missouri
byline: At least 21 people were killed overnight in Kentucky and Missouri when severe storms that spawned tornadoes ripped across the two states, officials said on Saturday (May 17), and the death toll is expected to rise.

title: Shots fired at Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle
byline: (UPDATED) Two unidentified men on a motorcycle have opened fire at a vehicle carrying the former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, and his lawyer at Dabare Mawatha in Narahenpita earlier today.
